standard_metadata.standard_description: Solve word problems leading to equations of the form px + q = r and p(x + q) = r, where p, q, and r are specific rational numbers. Solve equations of these forms fluently. Compare an algebraic solution to an arithmetic solution, identifying the sequence of the operations used in each approach.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Two-step equations with decimals and fractions

hints.content: Let's subtract and then divide to get $a$ by itself.

$\begin{align} 0.25a +0.5&= 4.5 \\ \\ 0.25a+0.5 \blue{-0.5}&= 4.5\blue{-0.5}~~~~\blue{\text{subtract }0.5} \text{ from each side}\\ \\ 0.25a+\cancel{ 0.5} {\blue{-}\cancel{\blue{0.5}}}&= 4.5\blue{-0.5}\\ \\ 0.25a &=4.5\blue{-0.5}\end{align}$

$\begin{align}0.25a &= 4 \\ \\ \dfrac{0.25a}{\pink{0.25}} &= \dfrac{4}{\pink{0.25}} ~~~~~~~\text{divide each side by } \pink{0.25} \text{ to get } a \text{ by itself }\\ \\ \dfrac{\cancel{0.25}a}{\cancel{\pink{0.25}}} &= \dfrac{4}{\pink{0.25}} \\ \\ a &= \dfrac{4}{\pink{0.25}} \end{align}$

The answer:  > $a=\green{16}$  Let's check to make sure.  >$\begin{align} 0.25a+0.5 &= 4.5 \\\\  0.25(\green{16})+0.5 &\stackrel{?}{=} 4.5 \\\\  4+0.5 &\stackrel{?}{=} 4.5 \\\\ 4.5 &= 4.5 ~~~~~~~~~~\text{Yes!} \end{align}$
Let's subtract and then divide to get $b$ by itself.

$\begin{align} -3b+2.5& = 4 \\ \\ -3b+2.5 \blue{-2.5}&= 4\blue{-2.5}~~~~\blue{\text{subtract }2.5} \text{ from each side}\\ \\ -3b+\cancel{ 2.5} {\blue{-}\cancel{\blue{2.5}}}&= 4\blue{-2.5}\\ \\ -3b &=4\blue{-2.5}\end{align}$

$\begin{align}-3b &= 1.5 \\ \\ \dfrac{-3b}{\pink{-3}} &= \dfrac{1.5}{\pink{-3}} ~~~~~~~\text{divide each side by } \pink{-3} \text{ to get } b \text{ by itself }\\ \\ \dfrac{\cancel{-3}b}{\cancel{\pink{-3}}} &= \dfrac{1.5}{\pink{-3}} \\ \\ b &= \dfrac{1.5}{\pink{-3}} \end{align}$

The answer:  > $b=\green{-0.5}$  Let's check to make sure.  >$\begin{align} -3b+2.5 &= 4 \\\\  -3(\green{-0.5})+2.5 &\stackrel{?}{=} 4 \\\\  1.5+2.5 &\stackrel{?}{=} 4 \\\\ 4 &= 4 ~~~~~~~~~~\text{Yes!} \end{align}$
Let's subtract and then divide to get $c$ by itself.

$\begin{align} \dfrac54&=-4c+\dfrac14 \\ \\ \dfrac54\blue{-\dfrac14} &=-4c+\dfrac14 \blue{-\dfrac14}~~~~~~\blue{\text{subtract }\dfrac14} \text{ from each side}\\ \\  \dfrac54\blue{-\dfrac14}&=-4c+\cancel{ \dfrac14} {\blue{-}\cancel{\blue{\dfrac14}}}\\ \\ \dfrac54\blue{-\dfrac14}&=-4c \end{align}$

$\begin{align}1&= -4c  \\ \\ \dfrac{1}{\pink{-4}} &= \dfrac{-4c}{\pink{-4}} ~~~~~~~\text{divide each side by } \pink{-4} \text{ to get } c \text{ by itself }\\ \\ \dfrac{1}{\pink{-4}} &= \dfrac{\cancel{-4}c}{\cancel{\pink{-4}}} \\ \\  \dfrac{1}{\pink{-4}}&= c \end{align}$

The answer:  > $c=\green{-\dfrac14}$  Let's check to make sure.  >$\begin{align} \dfrac54&=-4c+\dfrac14 \\\\   \dfrac54&\stackrel{?}{=} -4\left(\green{-\dfrac14}\right)+\dfrac14 \\\\  \dfrac54&\stackrel{?}{=} 1+\dfrac14 \\\\ \dfrac54 &= \dfrac54 ~~~~~~~~~~\text{Yes!} \end{align}$
Let's add and then divide to get $d$ by itself.

$\begin{align} \dfrac32&=5d-\dfrac12  \\ \\ \dfrac32\blue{+\dfrac12} &=5d-\dfrac12 \blue{+\dfrac12}~~~~~~\blue{\text{add }\dfrac12} \text{ to each side}\\ \\  \dfrac32\blue{+\dfrac12}&=5d-\cancel{ \dfrac12} {\blue{+}\cancel{\blue{\dfrac12}}}\\ \\ \dfrac32\blue{+\dfrac12}&=5d \end{align}$

$\begin{align}2&= 5d  \\ \\ \dfrac{2}{\pink{5}} &= \dfrac{5d}{\pink{5}} ~~~~~~~\text{divide each side by } \pink{5} \text{ to get } d \text{ by itself }\\ \\ \dfrac{2}{\pink{5}} &= \dfrac{\cancel{5}d}{\cancel{\pink{5}}} \\ \\  \dfrac{2}{\pink{5}}&= d \end{align}$

The answer:  > $d=\green{\dfrac25}$  Let's check to make sure.  >$\begin{align} \dfrac32&=5d-\dfrac12 \\\\   \dfrac32&\stackrel{?}{=} 5\left(\green{\dfrac25}\right)-\dfrac12 \\\\  \dfrac32&\stackrel{?}{=} 2-\dfrac12 \\\\ \dfrac32 &= \dfrac32 ~~~~~~~~~~\text{Yes!} \end{align}$
Let's add and then divide to get $e$ by itself.

$\begin{align} \dfrac43&=-6e-\dfrac53   \\ \\ \dfrac43\blue{+\dfrac53} &=-6e-\dfrac53 \blue{+\dfrac53}~~~~~~~~\blue{\text{add }\dfrac53} \text{ to each side}\\ \\  \dfrac43\blue{+\dfrac53}&=-6e-\cancel{ \dfrac53} {\blue{+}\cancel{\blue{\dfrac53}}}\\ \\ \dfrac43\blue{+\dfrac53}&=-6e \end{align}$

$\begin{align}3&= -6e  \\ \\ \dfrac{3}{\pink{-6}} &= \dfrac{-6e}{\pink{-6}} ~~~~~~~\text{divide each side by } \pink{-6} \text{ to get } e \text{ by itself }\\ \\ \dfrac{3}{\pink{-6}} &= \dfrac{\cancel{-6}e}{\cancel{\pink{-6}}} \\ \\  \dfrac{3}{\pink{-6}}&= e \end{align}$

The answer:  > $e=\green{-\dfrac12}$  Let's check to make sure.  >$\begin{align} \dfrac43&=-6e-\dfrac53\\\\   \dfrac43&\stackrel{?}{=} -6\left(\green{-\dfrac12}\right)-\dfrac53 \\\\  \dfrac43&\stackrel{?}{=} 3-\dfrac53 \\\\ \dfrac43 &= \dfrac43 ~~~~~~~~~~\text{Yes!} \end{align}$
Let's add and then divide to get $f$ by itself.

$\begin{align}1&= 0.5f  \\ \\ \dfrac{1}{\pink{0.5}} &= \dfrac{0.5f}{\pink{0.5}} ~~~~~~~\text{divide each side by } \pink{0.5} \text{ to get } f \text{ by itself }\\ \\ \dfrac{1}{\pink{0.5}} &= \dfrac{\cancel{0.5}f}{\cancel{\pink{0.5}}} \\ \\  \dfrac{1}{\pink{0.5}}&= f \end{align}$

The answer:  > $f=\green{2}$  Let's check to make sure.  >$\begin{align} 0.3&=0.5f-0.7 \\\\   0.3&\stackrel{?}{=} 0.5\left(\green{2}\right)-0.7 \\\\ 0.3&\stackrel{?}{=} 1-0.7 \\\\ 0.3 &= 0.3 ~~~~~~~~~~\text{Yes!} \end{align}$
Let's add and then multiply to get $g$ by itself.

$\begin{align} -0.4&=\dfrac g3-0.9   \\ \\ -0.4\blue{+0.9} &=\dfrac g3-0.9 \blue{+0.9}~~~~~~\blue{\text{add }0.9} \text{ to each side}\\ \\  -0.4\blue{+0.9}&=\dfrac g3-\cancel{ 0.9} {\blue{+}\cancel{\blue{0.9}}}\\ \\ -0.4\blue{+0.9}&=\dfrac g3 \end{align}$

$\begin{align}0.5&= \dfrac g3  \\ \\ {0.5}\cdot{\pink{3}} &= \dfrac g{3}\cdot{\pink{3}} ~~~~~~~\text{multiply each side by } \pink{3} \text{ to get } g \text{ by itself }\\ \\ {0.5}\cdot{\pink{3}} &= \dfrac g{\cancel{3}}\cdot{\cancel{\pink{3}}} \\ \\ {0.5}\cdot{\pink{3}} &= g \end{align}$

The answer:  > $g=\green{1.5}$  Let's check to make sure.  >$\begin{align} -0.4&=\dfrac g3-0.9  \\\\   -0.4&\stackrel{?}{=} \dfrac{\green{1.5}}3-0.9 \\\\ - 0.4&\stackrel{?}{=} 0.5-0.9 \\\\ -0.4&= -0.4 ~~~~~~~~~~\text{Yes!} \end{align}$
Let's add and then multiply to get $h$ by itself.

$\begin{align} \dfrac37&=\dfrac h{14}-\dfrac27  \\ \\ \dfrac37\blue{+\dfrac27} &=\dfrac h{14}-\dfrac27 \blue{+\dfrac27}~~~~~~\blue{\text{add }\dfrac27} \text{ to each side}\\ \\  \dfrac37\blue{+ \dfrac27}&=\dfrac h{14}-\cancel{ \dfrac27} {\blue{+}\cancel{\blue{\dfrac27}}}\\ \\ \dfrac37\blue{+\dfrac27}&=\dfrac h{14} \end{align}$

$\begin{align}\dfrac57&= \dfrac h{14}  \\ \\ {\dfrac57}\cdot{\pink{14}} &= \dfrac h{14}\cdot{\pink{14}} ~~~~~~~\text{multiply each side by } \pink{14} \text{ to get } h \text{ by itself }\\ \\ {\dfrac57}\cdot{\pink{14}} &= \dfrac h{\cancel{14}}\cdot{\cancel{\pink{14}}} \\ \\ {\dfrac57}\cdot{\pink{14}} &= h \\\\ {\dfrac{70}7} &= h \end{align}$

The answer:  > $h=\green{10}$  Let's check to make sure.  >$\begin{align} \dfrac37&=\dfrac h{14}-\dfrac27 \\\\   \dfrac37&\stackrel{?}{=} \dfrac{\green{10}}{14}-\dfrac27 \\\\  \dfrac37&\stackrel{?}{=} \dfrac57-\dfrac27 \\\\ \dfrac37&= \dfrac37 ~~~~~~~~~~\text{Yes!} \end{align}$
Let's add and then multiply to get $j$ by itself.

$\begin{align}-\dfrac13&=\dfrac j{4}-\dfrac{10}3   \\ \\ -\dfrac13\blue{+\dfrac{10}3} &=\dfrac j{4}-\dfrac{10}3 \blue{+\dfrac{10}3}~~~~~~~~\blue{\text{add }\dfrac{10}3} \text{ to each side}\\ \\ -\dfrac13\blue{+\dfrac{10}3}&=\dfrac j{4}-\cancel{ \dfrac{10}3} {\blue{+}\cancel{\blue{\dfrac{10}3}}}\\ \\ -\dfrac13\blue{+\dfrac{10}3}&=\dfrac j{4} \\\\ \dfrac93&=\dfrac j{4}  \end{align}$

$\begin{align}3&= \dfrac j{4}  \\ \\ {3}\cdot{\pink{4}} &= \dfrac j{4}\cdot{\pink{4}} ~~~~~~~\text{multiply each side by } \pink{4} \text{ to get } j \text{ by itself }\\ \\ {3}\cdot{\pink{4}} &= \dfrac j{\cancel{4}}\cdot{\cancel{\pink{4}}} \\ \\ {3}\cdot{\pink{4}} &= j \end{align}$

The answer:  > $j=\green{12}$  Let's check to make sure.  >$\begin{align} -\dfrac13&=\dfrac j{4}-\dfrac{10}3\\\\  -\dfrac13&\stackrel{?}{=} \dfrac{\green{12}}{4}-\dfrac{10}3 \\\\  -\dfrac13&\stackrel{?}{=} 3-\dfrac{10}3 \\\\  -\dfrac13&\stackrel{?}{=} \dfrac93-\dfrac{10}3 \\\\ -\dfrac13&=-\dfrac13 ~~~~~~~~~~\text{Yes!} \end{align}$
Let's subtract and then multiply to get $k$ by itself.

$\begin{align} \dfrac k{2}+\dfrac12&=3  \\ \\ \dfrac{k}{2}+\dfrac12\blue{-\dfrac12} &=3\blue{-\dfrac12}~~~~~\blue{\text{subtract }\dfrac12} \text{ from each side}\\ \\ \dfrac k2+\cancel{\dfrac12} {\blue{-}\cancel{\blue{\dfrac12}}}&= 3\blue{ -\dfrac12}\\ \\ \dfrac k{2}&= 3\blue{-\dfrac12}\end{align}$

$\begin{align}\dfrac k2&= \dfrac52  \\ \\  \dfrac k{2}\cdot{\pink{2}}&= {\dfrac52}\cdot{\pink{2}} ~~~~~~~\text{multiply each side by } \pink{2} \text{ to get } k \text{ by itself }\\ \\  \dfrac k{\cancel{2}}\cdot{\cancel{\pink{2}}} &={\dfrac52}\cdot{\pink{2}} \\ \\ k&= {\dfrac52}\cdot{\pink{2}}  \end{align}$

The answer:  > $k=\green{5}$  Let's check to make sure.  >$\begin{align} \dfrac k{2}+\dfrac12&=3  \\\\  \dfrac{\green{5}}{2}+\dfrac12&\stackrel{?}{=} 3  \\\\  \dfrac62&\stackrel{?}{=} 3 \\\\ 3&= 3 ~~~~~~~~~~\text{Yes!} \end{align}$
Let's subtract and then multiply to get $m$ by itself.

$\begin{align}  \dfrac m{9}+\dfrac23&=\dfrac73  \\ \\  \dfrac m{9}+\dfrac23\blue{-\dfrac23} &=\dfrac73\blue{-\dfrac23}~~~~~\blue{\text{subtract }\dfrac23} \text{ from each side}\\ \\ \dfrac m9+\cancel{\dfrac23} {\blue{-}\cancel{\blue{\dfrac23}}}&= \dfrac73\blue{ -\dfrac23}\\ \\ \dfrac m{9}&= \dfrac73\blue{-\dfrac23}\end{align}$

$\begin{align}\dfrac m9&= \dfrac53  \\ \\  \dfrac m{9}\cdot{\pink{9}}&= \dfrac{5}3\cdot{\pink{9}} ~~~~~~~\text{multiply each side by } \pink{9} \text{ to get } m \text{ by itself }\\ \\  \dfrac m{\cancel{9}}\cdot{\cancel{\pink{9}}} &=\dfrac{5}3\cdot{\pink{9}} \\ \\ m&= {\dfrac53}\cdot{\pink{9}}   \\\\ m&= {\dfrac{45}3}\end{align}$

The answer:  > $m=\green{15}$  Let's check to make sure.  >$\begin{align} \dfrac m{9}+\dfrac23&=\dfrac73  \\\\  \dfrac{\green{15}}{9}+\dfrac23&\stackrel{?}{=} \dfrac73  \\\\  \dfrac53+\dfrac23&\stackrel{?}{=} \dfrac73 \\\\ \dfrac73&= \dfrac73 ~~~~~~~~~~\text{Yes!} \end{align}$
Let's subtract and then multiply to get $n$ by itself.

$\begin{align} \dfrac n{5}+0.6&=2  \\ \\ \dfrac{n}{5}+0.6\blue{-0.6} &=2\blue{-0.6}~~~~~\blue{\text{subtract }0.6} \text{ from each side}\\ \\ \dfrac n5+\cancel{0.6} {\blue{-}\cancel{\blue{0.6}}}&= 2\blue{ -0.6}\\ \\ \dfrac n{5}&= 2\blue{-0.6}\end{align}$

$\begin{align}\dfrac n5&= 1.4  \\ \\  \dfrac n{5}\cdot{\pink{5}}&= {1.4}\cdot{\pink{5}} ~~~~~~~\text{multiply each side by } \pink{5} \text{ to get } n \text{ by itself }\\ \\  \dfrac n{\cancel{5}}\cdot{\cancel{\pink{5}}} &={1.4}\cdot{\pink{5}} \\ \\ n&= {1.4}\cdot{\pink{5}}  \end{align}$

The answer:  > $n=\green{7}$  Let's check to make sure.  >$\begin{align}  \dfrac n{5}+0.6&=2   \\\\  \dfrac{\green{7}}{5}+0.6&\stackrel{?}{=} 2  \\\\ 1.4+0.6&\stackrel{?}{=} 2 \\\\ 2&= 2 ~~~~~~~~~~\text{Yes!} \end{align}$
Let's divide and then subtract to get $t$ by itself.

$\begin{align}4\left(t+\dfrac14\right) &= 3 \\ \\\\ \dfrac{4\left(t+\dfrac14\right)}{\pink{4}} &= \dfrac{3}{\pink{4}} ~~~~~~~\text{divide each side by } \pink{4}\\ \\ \dfrac{\cancel{4}\left(t+\dfrac14\right)}{\cancel{\pink{4}}} &= \dfrac{3}{\pink{4}} \\ \\ t +\dfrac14&= \dfrac{3}{\pink{4}} \end{align}$

$\begin{align} t +\dfrac14&= \dfrac34 \\ \\ t+\dfrac14 \blue{-\dfrac14}&= \dfrac34\blue{-\dfrac14}~~~~\blue{\text{subtract }\dfrac14} \text{ from each side} \text{ to get } t \text{ by itself }\\ \\ t+\cancel{ \dfrac14} {\blue{-}\cancel{\blue{\dfrac14}}}&= \dfrac34\blue{-\dfrac14}\\ \\ t &=\dfrac34\blue{-\dfrac14}\end{align}$

The answer:  > $t=\green{\dfrac12}$  Let's check to make sure.  >$\begin{align} 4\left(t+\dfrac14\right)& = 3 \\\\  4\left(\green{\dfrac12}+\dfrac14\right) &\stackrel{?}{=} 3 \\\\  4\left(\dfrac34\right)&\stackrel{?}{=} 3 \\\\ 3 &= 3 ~~~~~~~~~~\text{Yes!} \end{align}$
Let's divide and then subtract to get $p$ by itself.

$\begin{align}-5\left(p+\dfrac35\right) &= -4 \\ \\\\ \dfrac{-5\left(p+\dfrac35\right)}{\pink{-5}} &= \dfrac{-4}{\pink{-5}} ~~~~~~~\text{divide each side by } \pink{-5}\\ \\ \dfrac{\cancel{-5}\left(p+\dfrac35\right)}{\cancel{\pink{-5}}} &= \dfrac{-4}{\pink{-5}} \\ \\ p +\dfrac35&= \dfrac{-4}{\pink{-5}} \end{align}$

$\begin{align} p +\dfrac35&= \dfrac45 \\ \\ p+\dfrac35 \blue{-\dfrac35}&= \dfrac45\blue{-\dfrac35}~~~~\blue{\text{subtract }\dfrac35} \text{ from each side} \text{ to get } p \text{ by itself }\\ \\ p+\cancel{ \dfrac35} {\blue{-}\cancel{\blue{\dfrac35}}}&= \dfrac45\blue{-\dfrac35}\\ \\ p &=\dfrac45\blue{-\dfrac35}\end{align}$

The answer:  > $p=\green{\dfrac15}$  Let's check to make sure.  >$\begin{align} -5\left(p+\dfrac35\right) &= -4 \\\\  -5\left(\green{\dfrac15}+\dfrac35\right) &\stackrel{?}{=} -4 \\\\  -5\left(\dfrac45\right)&\stackrel{?}{=} -4 \\\\ -4 &= -4 ~~~~~~~~~~\text{Yes!} \end{align}$
Let's divide and then subtract to get $q$ by itself.

$\begin{align}3\left(q+\dfrac43\right) &= 2 \\ \\\\ \dfrac{3\left(q+\dfrac43\right)}{\pink{3}} &= \dfrac{2}{\pink{3}} ~~~~~~~\text{divide each side by } \pink{3}\\ \\ \dfrac{\cancel{3}\left(q+\dfrac43\right)}{\cancel{\pink{3}}} &= \dfrac{2}{\pink{3}} \\ \\ q +\dfrac43&= \dfrac{2}{\pink{3}} \end{align}$

$\begin{align}  \\ q+\dfrac43 \blue{-\dfrac43}&= \dfrac23\blue{-\dfrac43}~~~~\blue{\text{subtract }\dfrac43} \text{ from each side} \text{ to get } q \text{ by itself }\\ \\ q+\cancel{ \dfrac43} {\blue{-}\cancel{\blue{\dfrac43}}}&= \dfrac23\blue{-\dfrac43}\\ \\ q &=\dfrac23\blue{-\dfrac43}\end{align}$

The answer:  > $q=\green{-\dfrac23}$  Let's check to make sure.  >$\begin{align} 3\left(q+\dfrac43\right) &= 2  \\\\  3\left(\green{-\dfrac23}+\dfrac43\right) &\stackrel{?}{=} 2 \\\\  3\left(\dfrac23\right)&\stackrel{?}{=} 2 \\\\ 2 &= 2 ~~~~~~~~~~\text{Yes!} \end{align}$
Let's divide and then subtract to get $r$ by itself.

$\begin{align}0.5(r+2.75) &= 3 \\ \\\\ \dfrac{0.5(r+2.75)}{\pink{0.5}} &= \dfrac{3}{\pink{0.5}} ~~~~~~~\text{divide each side by } \pink{0.5}\\ \\ \dfrac{\cancel{0.5}(r+2.75)}{\cancel{\pink{0.5}}} &= \dfrac{3}{\pink{0.5}} \\ \\ r+2.75&= \dfrac{3}{\pink{0.5}} \end{align}$

$\begin{align} r+2.75&= 6 \\ \\ r+2.75 \blue{-2.75}&=6\blue{-2.75}~~~~\blue{\text{subtract }2.75}  \text{ to get } r \text{ by itself }\\ \\ r+\cancel{2.75} {\blue{-}\cancel{\blue{2.75}}}&= 6\blue{-2.75}\\ \\ r &=6\blue{-2.75}\end{align}$

The answer:  > $r=\green{3.25}$  Let's check to make sure.  >$\begin{align} 0.5(r+2.75) &= 3 \\\\  0.5(\green{3.25}+2.75) &\stackrel{?}{=} 3 \\\\  0.5(6)&\stackrel{?}{=} 3 \\\\ 3 &= 3 ~~~~~~~~~~\text{Yes!} \end{align}$
Let's divide and then add to get $w$ by itself.

$\begin{align}4 &= 0.25(w-4.3) \\ \\\\ \dfrac{4}{\pink{0.25}} &= \dfrac{0.25(w-4.3)}{\pink{0.25}} ~~~~~~~\text{divide each side by } \pink{0.25}\\ \\ \dfrac{4}{\pink{0.25}}&=\dfrac{\cancel{0.25}\left(w-4.3\right)}{\cancel{\pink{0.25}}}   \\ \\ \dfrac{4}{\pink{0.25}} &= w-4.3\end{align}$

$\begin{align} 16&=w-4.3\\ \\ 16 \blue{+4.3}&= w-4.3\blue{+4.3}~~~~~~~\blue{\text{add }4.3} \text{ to each side} \text{ to get } w \text{ by itself }\\ \\ 16\blue{+4.3}&= w-\cancel{ 4.3} {\blue{+}\cancel{\blue{4.3}}}\\ \\ 16\blue{+4.3}&=w\end{align}$

The answer:  > $w=\green{20.3}$  Let's check to make sure.  >$\begin{align} 4 &= 0.25(w-4.3)  \\\\  4 &\stackrel{?}{=}0.25(\green{20.3}-4.3) \\\\  4&\stackrel{?}{=} 0.25(16) \\\\ 4 &= 4 ~~~~~~~~~~\text{Yes!} \end{align}$
Let's divide and then add to get $x$ by itself.

$\begin{align}-4.5 &= -0.5(x-7.1)\\ \\\\ \dfrac{-4.5 }{\pink{-0.5}} &= \dfrac{-0.5(x-7.1)}{\pink{-0.5}} ~~~~~~~\text{divide each side by } \pink{-0.5}\\ \\ \dfrac{-4.5 }{\pink{-0.5}}&=\dfrac{\cancel{-0.5}\left(x-7.1\right)}{\cancel{\pink{-0.5}}}   \\ \\ \dfrac{-4.5}{\pink{-0.5}} &= x-7.1\end{align}$

$\begin{align} 9&=x-7.1\\ \\ 9 \blue{+7.1}&= x-7.1\blue{+7.1}~~~~~~~\blue{\text{add }7.1} \text{ to each side} \text{ to get } x \text{ by itself }\\ \\ 9\blue{+7.1}&= x-\cancel{ 7.1} {\blue{+}\cancel{\blue{7.1}}}\\ \\ 9\blue{+7.1}&=x\end{align}$
Let's divide and then add to get $y$ by itself.

$\begin{align}-3 &= 7\left(y-\dfrac97\right) \\ \\\\\\ \dfrac{-3}{\pink{7}} &= \dfrac{7\left(y-\dfrac97\right)}{\pink{7}} ~~~~~~~\text{divide each side by } \pink{7}\\ \\\\ \dfrac{-3}{\pink{7}}&=\dfrac{\cancel{7}\left(y-\dfrac97\right)}{\cancel{\pink{7}}}   \\ \\ \dfrac{-3}{\pink{7}} &= y-\dfrac97\end{align}$

$\begin{align} -\dfrac37&=y-\dfrac97\\ \\ -\dfrac37 \blue{+\dfrac97}&= y-\dfrac97\blue{+\dfrac97}~~~~~~~\blue{\text{add }\dfrac97} \text{ to each side} \text{ to get } y \text{ by itself }\\ \\ -\dfrac37\blue{+\dfrac97}&= y-\cancel{ \dfrac97} {\blue{+}\cancel{\blue{\dfrac97}}}\\ \\ -\dfrac37\blue{+\dfrac97}&=y\end{align}$

The answer:  > $y=\green{\dfrac67}$  Let's check to make sure.  >$\begin{align} -3 &= 7\left(y-\dfrac97\right)  \\\\  -3 &\stackrel{?}{=}7\left(\green{\dfrac67}-\dfrac97\right) \\\\  -3&\stackrel{?}{=} 7\left(-\dfrac37\right) \\\\ -3 &= -3 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~\text{Yes!} \end{align}$
Let's divide and then add to get $z$ by itself.

$\begin{align}12 &= 15\left(z-\dfrac15\right)\\ \\\\\\ \dfrac{12}{\pink{15}} &= \dfrac{15\left(z-\dfrac15\right)}{\pink{15} }~~~~~~~\text{divide each side by } \pink{15}\\ \\\\ \dfrac{12}{\pink{15}}&=\dfrac{\cancel{15}\left(z-\dfrac15\right)}{\cancel{\pink{15}}}   \\ \\ \dfrac{12}{\pink{15}} &= z-\dfrac15\end{align}$

$\begin{align}\dfrac45&=z-\dfrac15\\ \\ \dfrac45 \blue{+\dfrac15}&= z-\dfrac15\blue{+\dfrac15}~~~~~~~\blue{\text{add }\dfrac15} \text{ to each side} \text{ to get } z \text{ by itself }\\ \\ \dfrac45\blue{+\dfrac15}&= z-\cancel{ \dfrac15} {\blue{+}\cancel{\blue{\dfrac15}}}\\ \\ \dfrac45\blue{+\dfrac15}&=z\end{align}$

The answer:  > $z=\green{1}$  Let's check to make sure.  >$\begin{align} 12 &= 15\left(z-\dfrac15\right) \\\\  12 &\stackrel{?}{=}15\left(\green{1}-\dfrac15\right) \\\\  12&\stackrel{?}{=} 15\left(\dfrac45\right) \\\\ 12&\stackrel{?}{=} \dfrac{60}5\ \\\\ 12 &= 12 ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~\text{Yes!} \end{align}$
